A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The Last Jedi's worst flaw - though there were many - is that it failed to regard the Star Wars universe with consistency. Characters used the force in incredible ways that directly contradict what was implied to be remotely possible in the entire history of the franchise. The fact that the film puts no effort into in-world consistency and instead bends the Star Wars reality to its narrative has severely damaged the within-universe realism of Star Wars as a whole.
